education.summary:

	â€¢ SQL and Data Modelling for the Web

Find the full syllabus here: https://www.udacity.com/course/full-stack-web-developer-nanodegree--nd0044

This course taught comprehensively various technical skills important in frontend web development. Completed several projects encompassing the knowledge of:

â€¢ Graduated with First Class Honours. 

â€¢ Relevant Coursework: Software Engineering Fundamentals, Computer Programming, Computer Architecture, Algorithms and Data Structures, Systems Programming, Machine and Assembly Language Programming, Digital Electronics, Digital Computer Design, Microprocessors & Microcomputers, Database Management, Computer Networks, Information Theory & Coding, Numerical Methods in Engineering, Technical Communication.

work.summary:
â€¢ Currently working with the Eyowo team to build out web interfaces that help users interact with the product - which provides financial services to anyone with a phone number. 
â€¢ Worked on front-end applications to drive NPower - a Nigerian Federal Government programme that addresses the problem of youth unemployment in the country. Worked alongside other disciplines including back-end, QA, design, and UI developers.

â€¢ Architecting and developing fully functional, accessible and responsive web applications using a wide range of tools and technologies for various clients. 
â€¢ Services provided for these clients span across front-end development to full-stack application development. Check out my portfolio to see some of these applications live.

â€¢ Worked with the software team to build software to support the company's hardware products. 
â€¢ Designed, developed and maintained the front-end application for the company's project using ReactJS, TypeScript and Material UI. 
â€¢ Developed web services for user and order management using Flask.

work.company: Eko Konnect Research and Education Initiative
work.summary: â€¢ Worked primarily with Linux (UBUNTU) as an operating system, learning about and unlocking its benefits and applications in everyday development.

anozie-stores.name: Anozie Stores
anozie-stores.description: For this project, Anozie Stores requested for a website to manage their orders and allow users track their order status. This resulted in my building a full-stack application for this online store. The completion of this project streamlined their order placement process and removed ambiguity, which led to a significant improvement in the shopping experience of their customers.

scribbles-blog.name: Scribbles Blog
scribbles-blog.description: Scribbles is a full stack blog application built using Flask and React. It allows authors to manage blog posts while readers can read and comment on each blog post. The blog posts are also available to users that are not logged in, but they are limited to just reading - they can't comment. A lot of the posts in this blog contain gibberish, but its simple UI gives me a lot of joy.

gff.name: Geraldine's Flourish Foods
gff.description: Geraldineâ€™s Flourish Foods, a food processing and packaging company requested a website to boost their online presence, serve as a source of information about their products and the services they offer, as well as a platform for customers to purchase their products. These requirements led to my building a full-stack application for this company. The resulting website offers the customers convenience as they can access any information about GFF they need and make any purchases of their products in the comfort of their own home.

pasteit.name: PasteIt
pasteit.description: PasteIt is an online clipboard which allows sharing of text over the internet by generating a unique URL. Others can access the contents of the paste via this URL. Built this because I got tired of opening Whatsapp each time I wanted to transfer text between my devices. This project makes use of ReactJS for the frontend, with Flask, PostgreSQL and SQLAlchemy for the backend.

nuvle.name: Nuvle
nuvle.description: This project involved building a Minimum Viable Product for a restaurant management system. Built a fully functional, accessible and responsive UI for the productâ€™s web application using React, Context API and Bootstrap 4. Integrated the web application with the backend by consuming RESTful API endpoints.

task-ager.name: Task-ager: The task manager
task-ager.description: Task-ager, Task Manager, get it ðŸ˜‰? Task-ager is a web-based task management application built with ReactJS. This project utilizes service workers which makes the app available to use even when the userâ€™s device is offline. Being a Progressive Web App, it can be installed and then launched by users just as if it were any native app.

portfolio-v2.name: Portfolio V2
portfolio-v2.description: Decided to work on a second version of my personal website. You could say this doubles as some sort of digital resumÃ©. Built with ReactJS. Donâ€™t forget to reach out!

fyyur.name: Fyyur
fyyur.description: Fyyur is a musical venue and artist booking site that facilitates the discovery and bookings of shows between local performing artists and venues. This site lets you list new artists and venues, discover them, and list shows with artists as a venue owner. This project involved building out the data models to power the API endpoints for the Fyyur site by connecting to a PostgreSQL database for storing, querying, and creating information about artists and venues on Fyyur.

classic-arcade-game.name: Classic Arcade Game
classic-arcade-game.description: My rendition of the popular arcade game Frogger. This was a project I worked on while taking the Front-End Developer Nanodegree course. The aim of this game is to get the player to the water as many times as you can before for the countdown stops, while also avoiding the enemy bugs. Use the arrow keys to move the player left, right, up or down. Colliding with an enemy bug resets your position. Try it out and make sure to share your high score with me ðŸŒš.

online-examination-system.name: Online Examination System
online-examination-system.description:
Built this as my final year project for my Computer Engineering Bachelorâ€™s Degree. In this project, I attempted to address some problems associated with paper-based examinations and also take into account some problems that could arise in a computer-based examination (such as power/network failure). 

 The resulting system has the following features: web-based software which can automatically and accurately grade examinations; compatible on any platform; distributes questions randomly to each student to reduce cheating; allows random selection of questions; incorporates accessibility considerations and is able to handle network or power failure by providing resumption capabilities. Built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap, PHP, MySQL.

contact-keeper.name: Contact Keeper
contact-keeper.description: Full Stack application to manage contacts. Includes authentication functionality. Built using the MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node) stack.

github-finder.name: Github Finder
github-finder.description: In this project, I make use of GitHub's Developer API to search for and display basic information about Github users.
